name: after
content:
after preposition
(FOLLOWING IN TIME OR PLACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 following in time, place, or order: Let's go for a walk after breakfast.life after death Some people believe in life after death. Her name came after mine on the list.the day after tomorrow There's a good film on the day after tomorrow.well after She waited until well after midnight.soon after She went back to work soon after the birth.a quarter after US It's a quarter after four.day after day She just keeps on working, day after day (= continuously).week after week She just keeps on working, week after week (= continuously). We've had meeting after meeting (= many meetings) to discuss this point. Jessie seemed very small after (= in comparison with) Michael's children. The children have to learn to tidy up after themselves (= after they have made things untidy). She slammed the door after (= behind) her. We ran after (= followed) him, but he escaped. Could you lock up after you (= when you leave), please?
